@Jessifer Some teachers rely too much on the text book. I don't use any.
@Jessifer I'd agree with digital book comment, I was considering physical version.
@Jessifer Navigation through the text book lies with the reader. The book is simply a repository.

RT @ToruOkada69: This is actually an excellent idea.

@TeacherROAR  https://t.co/ije91yuycf
Interesting. Other than sharing the  common affordance of transmission with other books, how is pedagogy hard-wired? https://t.co/d27US7C4JM
Does anyone still apply learning styles in their teaching?  As in visual, auditory etc.
Hell's bells there are so many educational bandwagons at the moment. I see lots jumping on, think I will wait for the next sensible one.
@Jessifer Text books were never meant to be a pedagogical method, they were merely adopted as such. Do not blame the tol, rather it's user.
Just has to be worth a re-tweet https://t.co/wsuYnBaoni

@horrocks_simon Oh Simon such a leading question! Sometime I insist they have their tech switched on sometime I tell them to ditch it.
@horrocks_simon I still have them Simon!
At the risk of being laughed at - how many of us now go into a class naked? That is without technology? #LTHEchat
@LTHEchat Sorry that was A3
@LTHEchat Can I counter with a question? Why use social media?
@hopkinsdavid @andrewmid @EricStoller Of course it's learning, it always was. #LTHEchat let's not complicate things!
@EricStoller @hopkinsdavid #LTHEchat Change is constant, all things are transient. Digital is the new printing press.
@anortcliffe #lthechat Do you think that students separate their digital presence from their physical one?
@EricStoller @hopkinsdavid #LTHEchat Whilst the 'medium may be the message' it is still the message that is important
I find the whole concept of differentiating 'digital' from 'physical' slightly absurd.  #LTHEchat
@hopkinsdavid @EricStoller #LTHEchat I would suggest it is all about communication.
@S_J_Lancaster #LTHEchat We still using concepts of visitors, residents and natives?
Mr. Piper: The Kindhearted Girl > Anyone out there that remembers Mr Piper? https://t.co/6aO4fxOV0e
Got that right  https://t.co/bNuruogz6w
@horrocks_simon I created a monster Simon. I introduced them to technology now s/he sees it as THE answer. Not what I intended.
Heard today about technology 'Oh you can do that? I'll use it' No thought given to the learning just the tech.
Many using technology to support learning are still making the mistake of choosing the technology before the learning

"E-learning is defined as “use of ICT to enhance acquisition of knowledge commonly known as learning" 
https://t.co/mJagoi3TRS
Do you agree?
@amyburvall @timbuckteeth :) Liquidised learning - I can see that gaining momentum.
@shaw2703 @stevewheeler (P2) I can envisage use of video etc.  Great that you are considering this.
@shaw2703 @stevewheeler Hi Rob, outside the Twitter chat this evening, do you have any ideas on how physical ed can be taught online? (P1)
#EDENChat @timbuckteeth Thanks for a stimulating discussion this evening.
@timbuckteeth #edenchat I think we were always blended learners.
@RouenGargan #edenchat I agree but the rise in openness contrasted with the cache of accreditation may signal a two tier system.
@timbuckteeth That is what I expect from my students ;)
#edenchat One of my students posed this. Are bricks (physical universities) for the rich and clicks for the poor?
@timbuckteeth @mweller #edenchat Would love to hear views on accessibility of learning, whether online or in the physical classroom
@timbuckteeth @amyburvall #edenchat The VLE has probably done more harm to distance learning than anything else.
@timbuckteeth something else. It's in my email somwhere. I took part a couple of years back and it is great. Will send you details
@timbuckteeth @shaw2703 #edenchat Isn't there a global 'teachmeet' coming up later this month?
@timbuckteeth ah APeL. Fair point but I don't see that working so well in my experience. Not to say it shouldn't.
@timbuckteeth #edenchat #edenchatUS easier yes but accreditation of perceived learning remains.
A1 learners deciding on their route their journey will take, flexible pathways. Difficult in current accreditation of learning #EDENchat
A1 nonlinear learning journeys  #EDENchat

Today I have spent nearly 7 hours in front on a PC writing an ethics approval application form. Joy.
@alejandroa @chrissinerantzi I've also seen evidence that supports a combination of bot intrinsic and extrinsic
@alejandroa @chrissinerantzi I was not advocating badges, just suggesting that both extrinsic and intrinsic drivers important for learning.
@alejandroa I don't think that is a reliable definition of 'short term'. Credibility coupled with longevity is another matter.
@alejandroa Naturally, 'short term' is ambiguous but I think peer pressure is a relatively long term extrinsic driver.
@alejandroa But, of course, not all extrinsic drivers are short term nor damaging.
